intro: Neobenthamia, commonly known as the "benthamia" or "false sandwort," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Montiaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous, and often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Neobenthamia species are characterized by their succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pink in color. They are adapted to survive in harsh conditions, often storing water in their fleshy leaves. The genus is native to regions of southern Africa, the Mediterranean, and parts of Asia.
